result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernesto Lee Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Sentencing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 22CF748, with credit for 0 days time served.  

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer.
- Complete a batter's intervention program.
- Complete a parenting class.
- No contact with OCT.
- Court set restitution at $0.
- Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. 
- Court ordered Defendant to pay all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during the period of Probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court DENIES expungement.

Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Elements of the Offense
and Addendum

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 8-8-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion for Joinder.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense needs discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned to 7-18-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference, by zoom.

Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Status following 22CF748. Case adjourn for Status.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant has retained Attorney Michael Chernin.  Case is removed the calendar.  Case remains schedlued for a preliminary hearing on  5-18-22 at 1:30 pm in Preliminary Hearing Court.

Case set for status following 22CF748. Matter is adjourned to Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez not in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant in custody.  No attorney has been appointed. Defendant has a felony case pending in prelim court on 3-30-22 at 1:30 pm.  This case is adjourned to the same date and court for a status conference.
Case is adjourned to 3-30-22 at 1:30 pm for status in preliminary hearing court.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with OCT (DOB 8/10/1994).

Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Ernesto Lee Rodriguez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ernesto Lee Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
